website_summaries.verdict: Best for fast-paced races and runs. Lower than a traditional gaiter – only come up to cover the ankle.
pros: Rugged, waterproof nature makes them good for all seasons
Runners love them for obstacle racing and ultra racing
Snug fit and reflective material to keep hikers and runners safe and comfortable
cons: No lace connection, so they tend to ride up

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I think this product ran a little big. I wear a size 12 shoe and have an athletic 6'1" 180 frame. The medium fit as expected, the large per instructions had large gaps and did not fit the ankle/lower calf as expected.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Tough Mudder approved!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both wore a pair of these yesterday for the Tough Mudder. They worked great! They kept rocks and clumps of mud from getting in our shoes and helped keep the laces protected. Several people on the course were asking where we got them. I highly recommend for OCR!
customer_reviews.author: T. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: They probably fit Salomon shoes better (I run Saucony)
customer_reviews.text: Need to return these, I ordered per my shoe size (10 mens) and they are much too large and don't fit right. The rubber strap across the bottom is too thick / large and my trail shoes aren't designed with a recess that allows the bottom strap to fit. They probably fit Salomon shoes better (I run Saucony). I would try a medium if I thought they were worth it. Ran a 13.5 Spartan Beast without them and didn't feel I needed them after the event. I admit gaiters may help with keeping dirt / mud out of shoe, but these aren't for me.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Large size is too big for size 13
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a Spartan race (12 mile beast). I have size 13 shoes, so I was concerned that the Large might be too small for my shoes. It turns out it's too big! The gaiters actually came off at one point during the race as I was running through the mud. The rubber strap across the sole of the shoe isn't tight enough to make sure it stays on. Overall, it kept quite a lot of mud and debris out of my shoe, but it was annoying having to worry about whether the gaiters were going to stay on or not, especially when running through deep mud.
customer_reviews.author: Lenz

customer_reviews.title: A let down
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in preparation for a trip to Upper Peninsul Michigan to go hiking. I hiked 26 miles on the first day with a 20lb sack and after one full day of use the gaiters are falling apart. The product is made with good quality, but the rubber that goes under the shoe isn't and is disintigrating quickly. I expected wear and tear, but not after one use. I expected more from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Hartley

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for a Tough Mudder race and performed as expected. My shoes stayed on my feet and I didn't get any rocks in my shoes. There was smaller sediment in my socks and shoes at the end of my race but nothing that caused skin irritation. I strongly recommend these. Pros: - Easy to put on and remove - Helps to keep shoes on your feet when walking through water and muddy areas - Keeps pebbles and larger sediment out of shoes and socks Cons: - can rub on the ankles if not positioned properly beforehand. Finding the proper position before walking through muddy areas is a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: RH2

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Obstacle course mud runs
customer_reviews.text: I've waited to review because I wanted the most race experiences. I've worn this for the Asheville Spartan Super and Spartanburg Beast races in addition to training trail runs. For regular trail runs, these are fine. For Spartan races, these will give you a headache. They kept coming loose in Asheville because of all the river crossings so I eventually just took them off mid-race. For Spartanburg, they held on much better due to less water crossings but they did start to loosen up at the velcro strap near the end. It did not do much to deter sand or small rocks in either race.
customer_reviews.author: Meg A.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me
customer_reviews.text: A low-profile gaiter big enough to keep debris out of my trail runners but not so big to look geeky. The size 9.5-12 gaiter fits my size 13 shoe well. The gaps at the top of the shoe are covered. At elastic band seals at the top. Comfortable -- I can't tell I'm wearing it. The strap under the foot is thin but seems tough. I expect it to last a while but even if I only get one season out of it, it is worth it. It is so nice to not have rocks and sand fall into my shoe. I don't hike when it is very rainy so I don't know how well it keeps water out.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Consider downsizing ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 15, but I have skinny ankles. Based on the sizing I bought a large, but they would not close around my ankles - so they pretty much just flop around. Consider that shoe size is based on length, and these gaiters have nothing to do with length, people with skinny ankles may need to downsize. I think that if they fit well they will work well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fall off to easily and can't get a secure fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought the recommended size but even on the tightest setting (it's a Velcro closure) they're way too loose and fall off within minutes. Wore them to a spartan race and instantly regretted it. They were flopping around my ankles within the first mile and I just had to run with them there since you can't leave anything on the course in those races. The materials seemed of high quality and durable tho, so I gave it 2 stars. Really wanted to like these. All my other Salomon gear is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Kcherep

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one season
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review, original review at the end: Made of cheap materials, stirrup broke after one season. Not worth the money. Original review: I didn't really like these when i first got them. They were difficult to position and didn't seem to fit well. After a few weeks of moderate use, they seem to have broken in nicely. They fit better, and stay in place well. They are still not great, but good
customer_reviews.author: El-Dave-O

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for an extremely wet and muddy trail race and they worked very well. Ran through all kinds of stuff and didn't get anything in the shoes. I was a bit skeptical that I needed to buy them but they turned out to be well worth it. My running shoes don't have much of an arch for the bottom of these to slip under but they still managed to work alright. I don't think they'd hold up that well running on a lot of pavement, though.
customer_reviews.author: HoiPolloi

customer_reviews.title: A must for hikers who don't like debris in their trail shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I love these Salomon Trail Gaiters. They fit securely and never come loose when hitting the trails. I use them on my trail shoes and hiking boots. I use the size large for my size 10 hiking boots and size small/medium for my size 10 trail shoes or runners. The quality of these gaiters are top notch as I have used the same ones for over three years and have yet to have any of them fall apart. I highly recommend these small, compact gaiters.
customer_reviews.author: ClimbHigh

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I included before and after pics from a trail run 10K that I did. They were comfortable and I forgot that they were there until the end of the race when I peeled them off to find that the only clean part of my socks was under the gaitors. They did their job perfectly. They also cleaned up pretty well and showed very little evidence of wear. I anticipate that I will make them look like the after pic many times before they quit.
customer_reviews.author: JBB

customer_reviews.title: No more rocks in my hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like low shoes when hiking distances on mostly flat terrain. These prevent rocks in my shoes which happens annoyingly often. When I get really off road they do protect my shoes\socks from burrs to a certain degree, but I really need them for the rocks. I was worried that the strap that goes under the shoe would either wear out, or be uncomfortable. Neither is the case. I love these and am glad I have them. They are also very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin I Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Over promised, under delivered
customer_reviews.text: Quick to get on and off but felt that the Velcro latch really wasn't fully sewn in the right place so the gaiter couldn't be fully tensioned and create a great seal. I wear a 12 and bought the 9.5-12 size and was still too loose around the ankles which is the whole point. bought these brand new and hiked the John Muir Trail. Very clean trail but already poked a couple holes through just from a few times my shoes hit each other with the first 20 miles. I am a Salomon fanboy but was eyeballing those Altra gaiters the whole trail after seeing these perform.
customer_reviews.author: WPrince

customer_reviews.title: Best investment a trail runner would make!
customer_reviews.text: Best $20 ever spent by trail runner. Not a single rock inside my shoes. You may want to order a size smaller. I have size 12 running shoes and average size ankles. Medium fit me well but Large would have been too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Bandana Man

customer_reviews.title: Keeps mud/silt/rocks out!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for one of those obstacle/mud/races with my Altra shoes. I'm pleased to say that it kept the inside of my shoes clean [as clean as possible on one of those things!] and free of debris. Also, the part looping under the foot did not interfere with traction with the shoe. No problems staying on or staying put. I'd recommend these to trail runners and obstacle runners for all purposes! Much better than just your regular shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BPB

customer_reviews.title: Not Tough Enough - Fell off quick
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these Salomon Gaiters to test them out at a 10 mile Tough Mudder event (9/29 - Dallas/Fort Worth) in preparation for World's Toughest Mudder in Atlanta this November. These gaiters didn't last very long through the trail, mud and water. I had to continually re-adjust them as I was running, which messed up my finish time, until about mile 4 when I noticed I lost the left one. About 2 miles later, the second was gone. If you're thinking about buying these and will be going through mud or water, I would recommend adding additional straps or duck tape to secure them.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Martinez

customer_reviews.title: No more rocks in my shoes while walking on street!
customer_reviews.text: I use these with walking tennis shoes for walking on the streets. I have always had problems with pebbles getting inside my shoes and having to stop and empty them (not easy while walking a dog). My wife never gets rocks in her shoes, but I always do. I think it is because I don't tie my shoes tight (it is painful to me) and I also walk "duck footed" which knocks rocks up into my shoes. This product solved it! This is my second pair. The rubber straps on the old ones are almost worn through. Surprisingly this took a couple years to happen. Great product that I never knew existed.
customer_reviews.author: ShorinRyu2

customer_reviews.title: Great for off-trail, mud runs!
customer_reviews.text: Not kidding about the bomb-proof strap! I ran a full Tough Mudder with these (12 Miles) and the Velcro never came off. In that kind of race, it won’t keep the mud out, but it will prevent sticks, rocks and other hard debris from getting into, which was most crucial. It also helped as an ankle stabilizer in the muddy, uneven terrain and it held my shoe on as I was pulling myself out of thick middle puddles. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick
customer_reviews.text: I used these on a mud run and i never had rocks in my shoes. I used them during a 5k and in a few weeks i'll be using them during a 8.3mi mud run! They work great! Update: they stayed on during the 8.3 mud run. I never had any large rocks get in my shoe and i didn't even notice was wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Bender

customer_reviews.title: I've got to order more.
customer_reviews.text: I often used gaiters for trail runs to keep dust, rocks and other trail debris from bruising my feet. Now retired, I mow a number of lawns, including weeding, trimming and edging. Have the best shoes, but often find them full of lawn debris which created lumps under my socks. Other gaiters looked very tacky with my shorts and rubbed my ankles, but these fit perfect and my feet never felt better.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but could use improvements
customer_reviews.text: The Salomon Trail Gaiters are a great product in concept, however did not fit as well as I had expected. I wear a size 8.5 and purchased a size Medium (7.5-9). I used these for a mountain running race and find that the velcro around the ankles does not get as tight as I would have liked and the strap under the heel does not stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Velcro needs work
customer_reviews.text: Velcro peals back and since it connects on the inside of your feet it tends to get hit by your other foot in rough country running
customer_reviews.author: MFCH

customer_reviews.title: Don't stay on during normal hiking activities
customer_reviews.text: I used these with my regular hiking shoes (Merrel) and at the beginning they worked fine to keep some debris out. After a few minutes the bottom part started sliding until it came out completely, provably because my shoes do not have the shape and sole of the regular Salomon trail running shoes. I would not recommend to buy these if you are planning to use other shoes that have other shape and type of sole. Update: So I bought a pair of Salomon Speedcross 3 expecting to get these gaiters to stay longer in place. Didn't work. They keep coming off. Terrible product!
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Too awkward for my feet
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it was due to my larger shoe size but I could never get these to fit quite right. I ended up cutting up my feet pretty bad after repeated use. The attachment kept digging into my ankle no matter what I tried. However, it did indeed keep the pebbles out =P
customer_reviews.author: Eric Provan

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the pebbles out of my running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item to keep pebbles / dirt out of running shoes jogging on dirt trails . They work. No pebbles or dirt in my shoes.. Only issue is the Velcro surface is to small so I can’t tighten them around my ankle like I would like. The quality of this item is good, they should last a while . Could have ordered a size smaller. Price is to high. That’s why 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: philip smith

customer_reviews.title: They work really good. I don't think anything would keep all the ...
customer_reviews.text: They work really good. I don't think anything would keep all the debris out, I still end up with a very small quantity of some very fine debris in each shoe, its such a small quantity that I don't even know it's there until removing my shoes after the race. They stay put and I haven't lost one in a mud pit, or swim across a pond yet. I haven't ever had to stop to remove my shoe and dump anything out in the middle of a race, since starting to use these gators. Theyre efinitely a must for the OCRs and mud runs. I use them with the Salomon Speedcross 3 trail running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: eric narducci

customer_reviews.title: Check your sizing.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product but the Large version seemed way too large for me. I wear everything from 10.5 to 11 in Aspics trail running and these were just too big. I do have thinner ankles so that may be a factor. By the time I wrapped the velcro around the ankle, there was barely enough to stay secure. I have read other reviews that seemed happy with the sizing, and some that weren't. It is a crap shoot sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: SuzanP

customer_reviews.title: No more rocks in my shoes!
customer_reviews.text: They look kinda weird, but keep the rocks out of my shoes on a looong hike. Prior to getting these, I had to reconcile myself to dumping rocks out the shoes many times a hike. I'd get one in my shoe w/in a minute. No more!
customer_reviews.author: VTP

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size, but great item!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these, but only because when I received them they were just a tad too small for the boots I planned on using them with. I have since ordered another pair by the same manufacturer which are a better fit, and they are great! Perfect for keeping out dirt and gravel from my boots while hiking!
customer_reviews.author: E Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!! No more dirt, rocks or debris goes into my shoe during my hikes or runs. If you're a hiker, trail runner, road runner and/or mudder, choose the right size and don't waste time and buy it. You will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I use them for Spartan races, they work well keeping out rocks and stuff. Don't have to take off my shoes after the mud pits anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Just get them, they work!
customer_reviews.text: Worse these on a hike with trail runners. I hadn't worn gaiters before and was suspicious, but I have to say I loved them! We had some unexpected snow so I was grateful to have these. They held up to a tough hike, did their job, and will be with me on many more!
customer_reviews.author: yogacat

customer_reviews.title: Shoe soles cannot be flat.
customer_reviews.text: The gaiters work well and stay snug. The size is listed as fitting up to size 12, but they fit my size 14s well. Keep in mind that these will not work on shoes with flat bottoms. You need to have a space between the mid foot and the heel that is raised to prevent wear and tear on the gaiter's under-shoe strap.I bought a pair of waterproof Saloman trail running shoes just for the gaiters (I know, like the tail wagging the dog), but the entire setup is worth it, and my feet stay nice and dry without all the sand dumped by trucks onto the snow all winter getting inside.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Constantine

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Have been dealing with small rocks, rock salt, infiltrating my shoes during my winter walks. These keep foreign particles out and save me stopping every five minutes to empty my shoes. They have also held up well in the slush, ice and gunk that fill our roads and sidewalks.
customer_reviews.author: sp0tz

customer_reviews.title: Work very well but are slightly fragile
customer_reviews.text: Good gaiters but they are a little fragile. I tested them out over 3 days backpacking with about 45 miles using them. After 3 days I had a small hole on one gaiter. Fit it good, and they definitely work keeping dirt and rocks out.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Duke

customer_reviews.title: what else could you want?
customer_reviews.text: Can you go out and get taller, bulkier, gaiters that will protect you better when out in taller, thicker scrub? Sure - but can you purchase better gaiters than these to use to participate in mud obstacle races? No Way!!! these things are great. Once you figure out how to get these things on, and get them properly fastened, you won't have to think about them again until your event is over and you are ready to take your shoes off. They move with you, they stay snug, and they keep everything out - perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Given

customer_reviews.title: A little short
customer_reviews.text: I wish they were a little taller, but great product.
customer_reviews.author: 24hourmom

customer_reviews.title: I lost one easily. So don't expect these to work for any ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought specifically to be used for a Tough Mudder, I lost one easily. So don't expect these to work for any mudding events. How they work on trail running, I never got the chance to test out, but I'm 99% certain it would be fine
customer_reviews.author: CCorns

customer_reviews.title: These are good for sneakers
customer_reviews.text: These are good for sneakers, but they were purchased for use with my Merrells. On my Merrell (low shoe), they do not cover the open areas adequately.
customer_reviews.author: jpkp

customer_reviews.title: Not a snug fit
customer_reviews.text: Tried these out but I couldn't really get them to fit snug to the point where I would be confident they would keep out the stuff you want to keep out. I did like how light they are and they were easy to put on and all that. Just not sure they will accomplish much. Better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: G. Long

customer_reviews.title: and most importantly they are still in good shape to use again
customer_reviews.text: I wore these during a full tough mudder, I had to adjust them a few times after some waist deep mud. They made it to the end, kept rocks out of my shoes, and most importantly they are still in good shape to use again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Fabian

customer_reviews.title: They do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to go along with a pair of Salomon trail running shoes. The shoes didn't work out, but these have gotten some mileage. I've worn them with my Merrill Trail Glove 4s. They stay put and don't slide. I have freakishly skinny ankles so there is still a little bit of space stuff can get in on the back side of the ankle. I don't fault Salomon for that, it probably works for others people.
customer_reviews.author: The Jean Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT GATORS
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gaters based on the review. They are excellent quality and truly help keep out, dirt, rocks and stickers while I hike. Great buy and I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: FotoDiva

customer_reviews.title: These just work
customer_reviews.text: They are sturdy and fit well on the shoes. They are not hot. I used them on a couple of brutal trail runs with lots of rocks, sand and volcanic ash and NOTHING got in my shoes. Im very impressed. I expect them to last quite a long time :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nations

customer_reviews.title: These worked great for my size 10 shoes until mile 3 of ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for my size 10 shoes until mile 3 of 10 and noticed one was missing after an obstacle.I had used them for 2 training runs and noticed the velcro was losing its stink. I shed the other to level the weight and stride. Sad they didnt last, but they do add significant weight.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Morrison

customer_reviews.title: works great for keeping pebbles/rocks out of shoes
customer_reviews.text: these are easy to put on and stay on your feet - no more stopping to dig rocks out of my sneakers when running! - they are a bit pricey but they work and you can put on quickly without any hassle.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Not great for trail running
customer_reviews.text: Stirrup does NOT stay under the shoe on long downhill trails. Pretty frustrating. I wear a size 11 shoe and ordered a large. Kept stuff out of my shoes but I had to stop more than once to push the stirrup back under my shoe.
customer_reviews.author: M Cox

customer_reviews.title: Work really well...
customer_reviews.text: These work VERY well at keeping stuff out of your shoes (and socks) while running. Just be sure to wear socks that come up above the upper edge of this product, because otherwise you'll rub your skin raw pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Cartridge Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I love these, but they don't last
customer_reviews.text: I use these for walking int the woods with my dogs, after just 6 months of use the bottom strap broke on one of the gaiters. Awesome concept, but not as durable as they could be.
customer_reviews.author: Scout

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Works great keeping debris out of shoes. Only down side is after some time it doesn’t seem like elasticity will last to keep a tight fit, but so far it has lasted for over 1 year, so I guess good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Ball

customer_reviews.title: i hate it. will not
customer_reviews.text: item is too big for me. i hate it. will not use
customer_reviews.author: Guilmar Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Not a pebble
customer_reviews.text: Kept rocks out of my shoes on the Colorado trail. I'd say they did the job well. Never came lose and covered top of shoe well enough to hike comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great for running Extreme obstacle courses!
customer_reviews.text: I wore these running in a recent Spartan Race. Kept mud, twigs, and rocks out of my shoes. Also covered my laces to prevent them from coming loose or getting stuck on something. Fits well, with stretchable material (unlike other brands I have used in the past) and durable under harsh conditions. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: ALBERT N.

customer_reviews.title: Rubbed me the wrong way, drat.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these gaiters. I use them for keep "stickers" out of my socks when doing off-trail hiking, and they worked really well for that. And are quite sturdy, taking quite a bit of abuse. But try as I might to adjust them, they keep rubbing skin off my ankle, sometimes on one foot, sometimes on the other, after a hike of a few miles. So they sit on my dresser, unused. Drat.
customer_reviews.author: Beege

customer_reviews.title: Straps broke on first wearing -- avoid this junk
customer_reviews.text: The leather strap on the bottom broke on the first wearing and cannot be replaced. I missed the return window and am stuck with this junk. Don't buy. Find gaiters with replaceable straps. They all break eventually, but shouldn't this fast.
customer_reviews.author: joeinlosangeles

customer_reviews.title: This is the mud gator to get
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit...kept out mud and stones in my Spartan Races...best of all I researched
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Ran a 50 mile trail ultra with them. Not a single rock in my shoes. They rubbed my skin raw at the top though.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Could be slightly larger for my bigger boots and not sure how waterproof they are but they work well to keep most of the muck out
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, inexpensive, not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a section hike in the Ozarks, and unfortunately they didn't hold up too well. The weeds and thorns did a number on them, creating several holes and snags. They were lightweight and the Velcro had them secure, but I wouldn't expect them to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great product highly reccomend for all mud course racers.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. arrived quickly and fit perfectly. I used them in 2 separate obstacle mud courses and they were priceless. I never had to worry about losing my shoes or tying my shoe laces so tight that it cut of circulation to my feet. I would highly recommend this product to anyone doing mud course racing.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my Spartan Race.
customer_reviews.text: These kept the small rocks and mud out of my shoes at my Spartan Race. They were awesome as others stopped to pull rocks out of shoes I kept going. I bought them small on the recommendation of others and they were almost too small, so I'm not sure what to say there. P.S. I wore Salamon shoes.
customer_reviews.author: VIP

customer_reviews.title: Need a better fit
customer_reviews.text: My first gaiters. Wore them for 25k trail run & had terrible pain at top of left one after 7 miles. Loosened & then was able to finish the race but left a terrible bruise that was sensitive to touch for days
customer_reviews.author: java123

customer_reviews.title: 5 to like 12ish. I’m a 9
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these in a large, as the size for L is 9.5 to like 12ish. I’m a 9.5 and these are way too big. Sending them back for a medium. Quality looks great, so I think I’ll be happy with the medium...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too durable
customer_reviews.text: I use these for keeping gravel out of shoes - I'm a PCT hiker. They work well; are easy to put on and take off; but are not very durable. I tend to kick my ankles together when hiking and they wore out on the inside lower part.
customer_reviews.author: tripleb

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Use these off and on for my 13 mile beast depending on what part of the race I was at worked well.
customer_reviews.author: amzonian

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: These survived 100mi of hiking in the cascaids, and 100 miles of the John Muir Trail. Good alternative to DirtyGirlGaiters.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Already falling apart after my first trail run, which was only 4 miles. I expect way better from Salomon.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit well on size 9.5 mens running/trail shoes. Issue is with the strap that goes under the sole. Would not buy these again, and won't likely use them again either.
customer_reviews.author: DRunner

customer_reviews.title: They kept the rocks out of my boots
customer_reviews.text: Did a 10/10 job keeping rocks out of boots. Extremely happy. Few trails around by me have smaller gravel which can cause big issue when it scattered into my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: William Cody Laeder

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I used these gaiters for a total of 5 times and they developed holes in them. Not very durable. the material is too thin to last. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AEG

customer_reviews.title: Works but blahhhh
customer_reviews.text: I have three pairs of this product. I like the idea and concept. The issue I have is the stitching of the velcros come off. Two of the velcros had to be resewn. Other than that, it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Boomersan

customer_reviews.title: Salomon is quality
customer_reviews.text: Started to do trail runs and this helped keep the sand and rocks out of my shoes. Fits great perfect for trails or spartan races
customer_reviews.author: Clinton S.

customer_reviews.title: Go smaller
customer_reviews.text: As most people say, they are way too big. I wear a 11.5 and 12 in my running shoes so I got the large and the medium. The large does not create a snug fit and leaves gaps. Put the medium on and fits perfect
customer_reviews.author: The Buzz

customer_reviews.title: It does it's job, at least.
customer_reviews.text: Although it does exactly as advertised, the strap that goes below the heel is annoying to walk on the flat ground. You can feel yourself rocking in your shoes. This concerns me on how long the strap will work before wearing out and need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: If they stayed on it might be worth it but otherwise I think they are just a piece unnecessary extra equipment
customer_reviews.text: I wore these gaiters in a 2016 Tough Mudder. I wore them with the Speedcross 3s. The right one stayed on the entire race without issues. The left one fell off twice and I had to stop to reattach. I think they did keep big stuff out of my shoes and a few others had to stop and empty out once or twice. But all the small dirt and sand still got in to my shoes. If I do the race again I don't think I will wear these gaiters. If they stayed on it might be worth it but otherwise I think they are just a piece unnecessary extra equipment. I loved the shoes though!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Bricker

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but good
customer_reviews.text: They work, but they are a bit too large. Only options were small or large. Maybe. Medium would’ve worked best, but Salomon doesn’t make it.
customer_reviews.author: H.Troy

customer_reviews.title: Solid as advertised
customer_reviews.text: As advertised- they kick butt in grass or dirt terrains
customer_reviews.author: Nick Conte

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: I went with the suggested shoe size and this product runs big. Perhaps it's my chicken ankle?! 😉 I added a piece of Velcro and they stay secure like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Hi

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, great for OCR racing
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the WV spartan beast and they worked great! No rocks or sand in my shoes for 14.5 miles, Velcro stayed in place and never once needed to be adjusted. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Hamon

customer_reviews.title: They keep the debris out of my sneakers on desert hikes..
customer_reviews.text: They keep all the twigs, dust, pebbles out of my sneakers while hiking in the desert. Work great. The largest size was almost to small for my size 13 sneakers, but they work...
customer_reviews.author: Thea Hill

customer_reviews.title: a little too low
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the pant leg slips out. It would be better with just another inch of height.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Best thing you could ask for when running on trails. Wore these on many trail runs and in the spartan Ultra in Tahoe. Performed flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: The Truth According To Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Kept sand out
customer_reviews.text: Ran a 50K in the sand with these, coupled with New Balance shoes. No sand in shoes at all. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: CherShelby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Work well. Velcro nice and wide. Don't know what I would if done without them on that crushed limestone.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Love the way these fit
customer_reviews.text: Love the way these fit! I bought them to use when running spartan races and they really do the job of 1) keeping lots (not all) of the mud, rocks, etc out of my shoes and 2) actually keeping my shoes on my foot when stepping into the mud pits. A total life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L

customer_reviews.title: Higher Socks + Gaiters = Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The important thing is to have high enough socks to protect you from the not so soft material on the top of the gaiters. If you get that covered they work great and don't interfere with running at all. I wore them for a trail marathon and for my training leading up to it and they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Chels

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: I could only like these more if the shoe had mounts for the gaiter to avoid the strap... I never have to take my shoes off to dump sand and pebbles out anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Buy them just Incase you run on lose rocks
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and very durable use during backpacking and trail running I wouldn’t run any dusty or gravelly trail without them
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: They looked very sturdy but has to return them as they were to ...
customer_reviews.text: They looked very sturdy but has to return them as they were to big. My foot is a womens 10 and the large was big. The didn't have a smaller size. I may reorder later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great price I’m a ancerage size female with average ankles. I wear a small the medium was a tad large for me. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Disc Golf Dj

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work well
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for a marathon ruck march in White Sands Missile Base. I still had sand in my shoes, but I think that came through the trail runners. They were pretty comfortable though.
customer_reviews.author: RunRunRun

customer_reviews.title: Must have for trail running and OCR
customer_reviews.text: Definitely love this product... I’ve been using it for more than a year and still running strong. If you’re into trail running , OCR and the likes you would appreciate this gaiters.. worth my money, this is my second gaiter since i lost the other pair..
customer_reviews.author: Edsy

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not very adjustable for slimmer ankles.
customer_reviews.text: Velcro isn't wrapped far enough around gaiter to allow a tighter fit at the ankle. But otherwise it does the job OK. I think something like a sock-sleeve at the top would be better to truly seal the shoe to rocks/debris. Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Size chart too big.
customer_reviews.text: Will do the job, but they fit larger than chart shows. I wear a 10.5 US and should have ordered in the 8.5 range.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Return
customer_reviews.text: Arrived soaking wet. The tags and labels attached were melted. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: ridere46

customer_reviews.title: Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: I hike quite a bit locally, so I needed a low gaiter to keep the small stuff out of my shoes and this product does the job! Its nice to get off the trail and not have to empty my shoes and they don't seem to mind the water either! Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: The Struggling Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Good low cut gaiter but wears prematurely at abrasion points
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these gaiters and they work pretty good. They are easy to get into since they wrap around the back. The material is stretchy and wraps around the shoe making a custom fit. My only beef with the product is that they wear prematurely on the inside right at the cuff of the shoe where they suffer from abrasion. That area should be reinforced with an abrasion resistant material at that point.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Lynch

product_meta.title: Salomon Trail Gaiters, Low
product_meta.description:
* Keep your trail shoe free from scree and debris with these Salomon® gaiters. 
 * Hook-and-loop closure allows for a secure, custom fit. 
 * Outsole strap keep gaiter securely in place. 
 * Salomon logo throughout.
   
 * 100% polyester. 
 * Imported.
feature_bullets: Ease of Use: when the trail becomes more of a rubble pile, simply slide these gaiters over your shoes and Velcro them closed.
Durability: a bomb-proof strap under the foot, durable mesh around the ankle, and lightweight padding on the ankle bone mean more adventures.
PROTECTION: scree fields can cause debris in the shoe and scrapes on your ankles. Since these gaiters are high, they prevent shocks to your ankle bones and keep the rough stuff away from scratches.
